channel.title: How to fix the red rings of death on a microsoft xbox 360
channel.description:
Note: This is not a perminate fix, But if your wanting to fix your xbox 360 in a short amount of time & without dishing out dollars or voiding the warranty this is the best way to do it. :)
Step 1. Remove everything but the power cable. (Hard drive, network cable, display cable etc.)
Step 2. Get a large cloth(s). (Like a blanket, or towels [Preferably 3])
Step 3. Set one of your cloth(s) down on a flat surface, Then put the 360 ontop of the cloth.
Step 4. Now wrap the cloth(s) around the xbox 360 like a christmas present. (Make sure you wrap it good or this wont work!)
Step 5. Feel around for the power button and push it.
Step 6. The waiting game, Leave your xbox 360 on wrapped in the cloth(s) for 15-25 minutes.
Step 7. After the time is up unwrap your 360 shut it off and leave it sit to cool down for about 30 minutes.
Step 8. After its cooled down plug everything back into your 360 and turn it on the rings should now be gone.
Step 9. Have fun, Your xbox 360 should now be fixed. So go play your games while you can! Note: you may need to do this every 4-7 days.
If this helped you please Rep++!
If you would like to add me on xbox live my gamertag is joeinpian exactly how spelled its like that because my friend can't spell correctly lol. Maybe I'll see you on xbox live!

item.title: How to fix the red rings of death on a microsoft xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“Owner_Of_GdogScape, post:26, topic:318223”][quote author=TOMSCAPE BETA link=topic=414714.msg3053693#msg3053693 date=1260291000]

Are you taking the piss? How does this help is anyway what so ever. There’s different fixes for different problems, Some involve opening your Xbox’s case, other involve simple things. How does overheating your Xbox benifit you? Infact this will make it worse, it’d overheat more componants in your console.

@ollie, yeh apparntly it helps, this will add more heat causing it to become worse (according to a site). Also I’ve just googl’d this stratergy, i smell bullshit. Also I just tried this stratergy on my OLD Xbox, doesn’t work. I have a new one now, but i didn’t sent the old one off.

What this does it the connection is melted on the heat sink and then re-connected upon drying to help it work. But if you have the option of sending your xbox 360 in and don’t mind waiting do it.
And dude, you didn’t leave your xbox on long enough to let it do its thing…I posted this topic @ 10:30AM Central time, You replied to the topic @ 10:47AM you try leaving it on longer…

This isn’t the first time i’ve tried this fail method. Doesn’t work.
[/quote]
Well then somthing else is fucked up, Cause we fixed my friends Xbox using this…[/quote]

haha, my cousin just came up to my house and he actually got RROD the other day, he searched on internet for what to do and he saw this method but he said, FUCK THAT. so what he did was take out all cables etc for half a day, then he plugged back in and it was working again. lol. btw, hes 24.

Read full topic
item.source: How to fix the red rings of death on a microsoft xbox 360

ive had my ps3 3-4 years and it hasnt crapt out on me, 360 PHAILS!, get a ps3

does ps3 even have RROD?
[/quote]No[/quote]

It has YRoD’s. Stands for Yellow Rings of Death.

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix the red rings of death on a microsoft xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“ollie123, post:7, topic:318223”]My 360’s graphics chip overheated and melted and I smashed it until it was in fucking pieces.

BILL GATES IS THE DEVIL.[/quote]
To bad microsoft doesn’t make 99.9% of the parts inside the xbox. All they did was package them together and write the code. But things like the motherboard, the disk drive, the graphics card, and basically everything else was made by other companies.

Truthfully though, if you got the xbox when it first came out, the best thing you can do is crack the case and install extra fans or a water cooling system.

Read full topic

Fat Cookies:

It will, without a question, void your warrenty which is like 3 years long. Just send it back to m$, yes it will take long but it is worth it.

Dude, the only way you can void your warranty is if you OPEN you xbox 360.
Aka removing the holographic sticker on the bottom of your 360. Or putting a hole through it, And there is a screw under that holographic sticker.

take it to a game shop.[/quote]
Why? If you still have your warranty and you don’t mind waiting for your xbox to be returned then theres no point in doing that and if you let them do it that voids your warranty (If you still have it)…And if you don’t have your warranty why not just do this? And if you don’t feel right doing this it would still probably be cheaper to send it into microsoft.
The only reason I would see taking it to a gaming shop would be to sell it.
